definitions: (of a person) able to recognize or make distinctions with accuracy

examples.text: she needs to be discriminative when it comes to investment of valuable resources

shortDefinitions: able to recognize distinctions with accuracy

definitions: making or showing an unjust or prejudicial distinction in the treatment of different categories of people, especially on the grounds of ethnicity, sex, age, or disability

examples.text: her statements were discriminative against minority groups

shortDefinitions: making unjust distinction between different categories of people
